texto: sometimes documented, and a decision is given on how the dispute should be resolved. This method is legally binding on the parties and enforceable in court a) in the absence of further action by either party, or b) if accepted within a certain period of time, by the complainant, or c) if not rejected within a certain period of time, by either party. NOTE 1 The situation described in bullet a) is typically referred to as (binding) arbitration or evaluation ; the situations described in bullets b) and c) are sometimes referred to as conditionally binding arbitration or evaluation . NOTE 2 As indicated elsewhere, in some parts of the world it is not permitted to bind some complainants legally.
